de.undercouch.citeproc.remote

Class RemoteConnectorAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.undercouch.citeproc.remote.RemoteConnectorAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RemoteConnector
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticatedRemoteConnector

    public class RemoteConnectorAdapter
extends Object
implements RemoteConnector
    Can be used by RemoteConnector implementations to delegate to an underlying connector
    Author:
    Michel Kraemer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteConnectorAdapter(RemoteConnector delegate)
      Creates a new adapter for the given underlying connector

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorizationURL

        public String getAuthorizationURL()
                           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteConnector
        Gets a new authorization URL from the remote server. This is the first step in the OAuth authorization process. The user has to visit the authorization URL and grant access to this app. Then they will get an verification code which has to be passed to RemoteConnector.authorize(String)
        Specified by:
        getAuthorizationURL in interface RemoteConnector
        Returns:
        the URL the authorization URL
        Throws:
        IOException - if the authorization URL could not be retrieved

      • authorize

        public void authorize(String verificationCode)
               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteConnector
        Authorizes the app. This is the third step in the OAuth authorization process. After the user has visited the authorization URL that was generated by RemoteConnector.getAuthorizationURL(), this method has to be called to finish authorization
        Specified by:
        authorize in interface RemoteConnector
        Parameters:
        verificationCode - the verification code the user received from the authorization URL
        Throws:
        IOException - if authorization failed

      • setAccessToken

        public void setAccessToken(String token,
                           String secret)
        Description copied from interface: RemoteConnector

        Authorizes the app. If you already know a valid OAuth access token (for example if you cached it from previous sessions) you may call this method instead of RemoteConnector.getAuthorizationURL() and RemoteConnector.authorize(String).

        This method just saves the provided access token. It does not act with the remote service in any way.

        Specified by:
        setAccessToken in interface RemoteConnector
        Parameters:
        token - the access token value
        secret - the access token's secret
        See Also:
        RemoteConnector.getAccessTokenValue(), RemoteConnector.getAccessTokenSecret()

      • getAccessTokenValue

        public String getAccessTokenValue()
        Specified by:
        getAccessTokenValue in interface RemoteConnector
        Returns:
        the access token's value used for authentication or null if the app is not yet authenticated
        See Also:
        RemoteConnector.setAccessToken(String, String)

      • getAccessTokenSecret

        public String getAccessTokenSecret()
        Specified by:
        getAccessTokenSecret in interface RemoteConnector
        Returns:
        the access token's secret used for authentication or null if the app is not yet authenticated
        See Also:
        RemoteConnector.setAccessToken(String, String)

      • getItemIDs

        public List<String> getItemIDs()
                        throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteConnector
        Requests a list of item IDs from the server. The user has to be authenticated before this method can be called.
        Specified by:
        getItemIDs in interface RemoteConnector
        Returns:
        the item IDs
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - if the user is not authenticated
        RequestException - if the server returns an error code
        IOException - if the items could not be read from the server

      • getItem

        public CSLItemData getItem(String itemId)
                    throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteConnector
        Requests an item from the service. The user has to be authenticated before this method can be called.
        Specified by:
        getItem in interface RemoteConnector
        Parameters:
        itemId - the item's ID
        Returns:
        the item
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - if the user is not authenticated
        RequestException - if the server returns an error code
        IOException - if the item could not be read from the server

      • getItems

        public Map<String,CSLItemData> getItems(List<String> itemIds)
                                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteConnector

        Requests several items from the service. The user has to be authenticated before this method can be called.

        Some services support bulk loading. In this case, this method makes as few requests as possible. The RemoteConnector.getMaxBulkItems() method returns the maximum number of items that can be queried within one request.

        Specified by:
        getItems in interface RemoteConnector
        Parameters:
        itemIds - the IDs of the items to request
        Returns:
        a map mapping item IDs to retrieved items
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - if the user is not authenticated
        RequestException - if the server returns an error code
        IOException - if one of the items could not be read from the server
        See Also:
        RemoteConnector.getMaxBulkItems()

      • getMaxBulkItems

        public int getMaxBulkItems()
        Specified by:
        getMaxBulkItems in interface RemoteConnector
        Returns:
        the maximum number of items that can be queried within one request
        See Also:
        RemoteConnector.getItems(List)
